Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the importance of Mark Warner's vote in the passing of Obamacare by stating that it wouldn't have passed without his vote.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to prove that Obamacare wouldn't have passed without Mark Warner's vote.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that Mark Warner's vote was essential to the passage of the health care package without providing substantial evidence.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim ignores the fact that there were 59 other senators who also voted to end the filibuster, suggesting that Warner's vote was not the only decisive one.
